title.narrative: Feasibility Study - DONETSK INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT IMPROVEMENT AND EXPANSION FEASIBILITY STUDY, through Government of Ukraine

description.narrative: This $520,209 grant funds a feasibility study on the improvement and expansion of the Donetsk International Airport in Eastern Ukraine. This project would allow the already capacity-constrained airport to continue its passenger traffic growth.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Desk Study - RAILRUNNER INTERMODAL SYSTEM, through Seneca Group, LLC

description.narrative: This $8,000 Desk Study reviews a proposal for a feasibility study on the RailRunner System project in Ukraine.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - SUMY WASTE RECYCLING & REFUSE DERIVED FUEL PLANT, through Government of Ukraine

description.narrative: This $350,000 feasibility study grant helps the city of Sumy, Ukraine to reduce landfilling, as well as provides a source for recycled materials and renewable fuels. The 80,000 ton per year municipal solid waste recycling and refuse derived fuel plant would reduce greenhouse gas emissions.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Orientation Visit - POWER PLANT MODERNIZATION REVERSE TRADE MISSION, through Global Marketing & Communications, Inc.

description.narrative: This $251,058 Ukraine Power Plant Modernization Reverse Trade Mission helps thermal power plant operators in Ukraine to become acquainted with the latest U.S. technology as they modernize their thermal power plants. Modernization of the power plants includes efficiency improvements and reductions in air pollution.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - PILOT GAS CONDENSATE PRODUCTION PROJECT, through Government of Ukraine

description.narrative: This $723,659 technical assistance (TA) grant provides funding to prepare a pilot implementation of enhanced gas production techniques for AC "Ukrgasvydobuvannya " the primary Ukrainian state-owned gas production company. The TA provides the Grantee an assessment of the available advanced technical options, operational viability and economics of producing gas condensate fields among its operating assets.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - BURSHTYNSKAYA POWER PLANT MODERNIZATION, through Government of Ukraine

description.narrative: This $602,435 feasibility study grant supports the Grantee, DTEK LLC (DTEK), in its effort to determine the technical, economic and financial feasibility of a plan to construct an advanced ultra-supercritical high-efficiency 800 megawatt (MW) power plant replacing four existing 200 MW outdated units. This project would help DTEK provide lower-emission electricity more efficiently to the surrounding area, as well as potentially export the electricity.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - National Emergency Telephone Call Response System FS, through Winbourne & Costas, Inc.

description.narrative: This $696,125 contract funds a feasibility study on a National Emergency Telephone Call Response System for the Ukrainian Ministry of Emergencies. The system will include Emergency Management Operations Centers, which would receive emergency calls and coordinate responses to those calls.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Desk Study - Contractor Selection and Invoice Review for the National Emergency Telephone Call Response System FS, through Ascendant Program Services, LLC

description.narrative: This $35,000 Desk Study (DS) provides expert technical advice to USTDA during the selection of a contractor for the Ukraine National Emergency Call Response System Feasibility Study (FS). In addition, this DS provides deliverable and invoice review services for USTDA during the period of the FS.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Orientation Visit - Emergency Management Reverse Trade Mission, through Koeppen, Elliot & Associates, Ltd.

description.narrative: This $238,386 reverse trade mission (RTM) of Ukrainian emergency management, aviation security and event security officials assists U.S. businesses in presenting U.S. emergency management and security solutions. The RTM allows Ukrainian officials to gain exposure to U.S. technology and practice in emergency management and security. The RTM includes visits to U.S. facilities and meetings with leading U.S. companies and U.S. Government agencies active in emergency management, aviation security and event security.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles
